title: How effective was the Sturmtiger in WWII? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was highly effective as long as it had an experienced crew and wasn’t broken down. The Sturmtiger performed the best when it could sit stationary and pick off targets a good distance away due to the limited gun transverse. Anything close required the tank to turn to face it, which placed considerable strain on the drivetrain due to it’s excessive weight. An experienced crew could do that without tearing things up while poorly trained crews could ruin the transmission on their first attempt. I’m pretty sure that the smart crews would back up while turning then move forward and the rookies would try pivoting in place which brought instant disaster. 20% of Sturmtigers were combat losses with 80% destroyed or abandoned by their crews due to breakdowns.
With a 380 mm motor what do you think ? It was very effective but they could not produce enough. The very effective Jagpanther was one of the most effective vehicles in WW2.
